subject: Programming
title: Al-Khwarizmi and the Origin Story
description: A 60-second lesson on Al-Khwarizmi and the Origin Story.

hook.text: The word 'algorithm' comes from a ninth-century Persian mathematician's name.

buildup.text: Al-Khwarizmi wrote a book on solving equations using systematic, repeatable steps.

discovery.text: His methods spread across Europe and became the foundation of algebra and computation.

twist.text: He never saw a computer. His algorithms were designed for humans working with pen and paper.

climax.text: Twelve centuries later, every computer on Earth runs on his core idea: follow the steps.

punchline.text: A ninth-century idea runs every modern machine.

quiz.question: Where does the word 'algorithm' come from?
